c88a225f-f7f8-4106-ba51-ede27697c5d6.description: The course details: 1. the mineralogical tools and data to undertake capably a mineralogical process performance assessment and 2. to use best available analytical methods to interpret the data and its implications for metallurgical processes. 5c3c0d2d-5f30-4e99-9651-3c362246fcda.description: Mineral Processing in the Mining Value Chain first describes the importance and scale of the mining industry and places it in a global context. The metal and mining value chains are defined and compared. Second, the business of mining, the mine life cycle and the role of mineral processing in adding value in the mine vale chain are covered. Third, responsible delivery of metals and mining are introduced in their social and environmental context, as well as future challenges facing the industry.
5c3c0d2d-5f30-4e99-9651-3c362246fcda.name: VALUE CHAIN

Completed Metcelerate Value Chain Module 2. Completed satisfactorily the learning activity and assignment required: Review of a Mine Feasibility Report
Completed Metcelerate Value Chain Module 3. Completed satisfactorily the learning activity and assignment required: Interpretation of the Company Sustainability Report

Complete Metcelerate Flotation Module 3: Making use of laboratory data, scale-up and applications of laboratory tests. Complete satisfactorily the learning activities and projects required

8fc0b584-499f-40ca-921b-6b1bb7f22817.description: Develop knowledge of the basic concept of leaching, leaching reactions, main factors influencing the rate and extent of leaching, and types of leaching configurations. Understand the chemistry and operations of copper, gold, aluminium, and uranium leaching. Understand leaching's impact on downstream purification and recovery; solvent extraction, electrowinning (for copper) and carbon adsorption, zinc cementation, and electrowinning (for gold). Become aware of safety and environmental issues.
8fc0b584-499f-40ca-921b-6b1bb7f22817.name: HYDROMETALLURGY

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Metcelerate Hydrometallurgy Module 1, that covers the theoretical fundamentals, types of input materials, different leaching chemistries based on the mineralogy of the feed, flowsheet configurations, and equipment used for leaching. It also provides a high-level overview of selected downstream purification and metal recovery processes.  Complete satisfactorily the learning activities and the project: Assessment of the technical and operational performance of a leaching circuit

42ac4c96-0372-4900-894f-b7e38fe6f9be.description: The PHYSICAL SEPARATION course introduces the physical separation methods most commonly encountered in mineral processing operations, and the fundamental processes behind them. The two modules cover solid-solid separation, and solid-liquid separations.
42ac4c96-0372-4900-894f-b7e38fe6f9be.name: PHYSICAL SEPARATION

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Metcelerate PHYSICAL SEPARATION Module 1: An introduction to the solid-solid separations and key concepts. This involves the separation of ore minerals from waste minerals based on some physical difference in their properties, such as colour, density, magnetic susceptibility and electrical conductivity.  Complete satisfactorily the learning activities and projects required.
Complete Metcelerate PHYSICAL SEPARATION Module 2: Solid-Liquid Separation. Complete satisfactorily the learning activities and projects required

Physical Separation assignments: Assignment 1: Problem solving for XYZ mining company.  Assignment 2: There are two options for this assignment. Option 1 is compiling a high-level description of the solid-liquid separation circuits at an operating plant and a detailed description of one of these circuits, including common issues. Option 2 is an experimental work - conducting a typical settling test.

Learners meet the Metcelerate team, experience the Learning Management System and the on-line Tutorials. They gain experience of submitting an assignment and receiving and accepting a badge.

1ae28602-5547-4873-9e55-f4757f40a445.description: The course develops competency in designing experiments, analysing mineral processing data and selecting the appropriate statistical tool to extract the full value from mineral processing plant data. It also develops proficiency in using statistical tools.
1ae28602-5547-4873-9e55-f4757f40a445.name: EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN & STATISTICAL METHODS

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Metcelerate Experimental Design course. Completed satisfactorily the learning activities and projects required. Aspects include: The value of statistical analysis in mineral processing. The breadth of the tool-kit, how to access statistical tools. Data collection. Working with statistical tools, dealing with common forms of mineral processing data. Designing and analyzing efficient experiments.

74421d20-f354-42cf-84b6-a458119bac16.description: The Metcelerate Mentor badge is awarded for those professionals that support the experience, progress and activities of the learners on the program.

badge_template_activities.title: Act in a supervisory role and support the Metcelerate learners

bb1fe377-6090-41e7-b46e-bb7c656bf01c.description: Apply the knowledge and capabilities developed in the Metcelerate program to a specific technical investigation or design. The project is a complex, open-ended problem that requires the acquisition, analysis and interpretation of results and provides an opportunity for creativity. Successful completion of the project means that the participant has demonstrated an ability to formulate a problem, schedule resources and find solutions by applying appropriate mineral processing tools and methods.
bb1fe377-6090-41e7-b46e-bb7c656bf01c.name: PROJECT

badge_template_activities.title: MODULE 1: Developing a problem definition. COMPONENTS: a) Technical investigations and the scientific method. Establishing a hypothesis. Asking the right questions. b) Identifying types of problem. c) Problem definition. d) Internal and external search of relevant prior work in the problem area. ASSIGNMENT: Develop a preliminary problem definition.

MODULE 2: Developing and demonstrating skills in project management and data presentation. COMPONENTS: a) Structured problem-solving. b) Data presentation and reporting. c) Identify obstacles (critical issues, critical path, project boundaries). ASSIGNMENT: Update problem definition and develop preliminary project plan (tasks, timing, resources, assignments).

MODULE 3: Ongoing skills development in executing a technical investigation. COMPONENTS: a) data collection and analysis. b) review of sampling theory and practice. c) project management. d) data presentation. e) project-related capability development. ASSIGNMENT: Preliminary progress report. Written report introducing the study, background, preliminary results and observations, proposed method of analysis, supporting figures/tables/images, discussion, and references.

MODULE 4: Communication and implementation. COMPONENTS: a) presentation skills, report writing skills, and technical communication to a non-technical audience. b) technical coaching sessions focusing on specific skills required for the selected project. c) leading and managing for successful change. ASSIGNMENT: Final written report supported by oral presentation.

fd70befe-4b3e-4fc4-afac-45a51c391e4f.description: The Problem Definition (PD) course develops an understanding of workplace problems, including the What, Why, When, Where, and Who, and circulation and sign-off. This is a critical and often overlooked aspect of problem solving and project management to avoid the persistence of problems and wasted effort. Participants complete am assessed Problem Definition, learning the difficulty and value of clearly defining a problem and so improving their ability to solve problems.
